intro: Banisteriopsis membranifolia, commonly known as the membranous bark tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon Basin. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and distinctive, woody, membranous bark. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody capsules containing seeds. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying tropical flora.
